issue.title: [CF 620] Icon Type "Spell Cooldown" has gone missing...
issue.body:
All of my icons tracking spell cooldowns have stopped working with 6.0.3.

Getting "cooldown: UNKNOWN TYPE"

and "spell cooldown" is now missing from the menu.


> Posted by CurseForge user Tenzian | Imported from CurseForge issue #620 | Raw

comments.body:
Could you please go into World of Warcraft/Logs and attach FrameXML.log to this ticket? It should contain information I need to solve this issue.

Also, if you have not done so already, please enable Lua errors in-game and post any erorrs that pop up.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Aha...

I'm using the nolib version. Looks like missing SpellRange-1.0 may be the culprit:

``` 9/14 19:27:52.064 Loading add-on TellMeWhen 9/14 19:27:52.064 ** Loading table of contents Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.toc 9/14 19:27:52.064 ++ Loading file Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Components\includes.core.xml 9/14 19:27:52.064 ++ Loading file Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Components\Core\includes.core.xml 9/14 19:27:52.064 ++ Loading file Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Components\Core\Conditions\includes.core.xml 9/14 19:27:52.064 ++ Loading file Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Components\Core\Conditions\Categories\includes.core.xml 9/14 19:27:52.064 ...hen\Components\Core\Conditions\Categories\Spells.lua:199: Cannot find a library instance of "SpellRange-1.0". 9/14 19:27:52.064 ++ Loading file Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Components\IconTypes\includes.core.xml 9/14 19:27:52.064 ++ Loading file Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Components\IconTypes\IconType_cooldown\includes.core.xml 9/14 19:27:52.064 error in error handling 9/14 19:27:52.064 ++ Loading file Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Components\IconTypes\IconType_reactive\includes.core.xml 9/14 19:27:52.064 error in error handling ```
Edited Sep 14, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Tenzian

Yup. That would definitely do it.

http://wow.curseforge.com/addons/libspellrange-1-0/

Edited Sep 14, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Yep - works perfectly once I've manually installed the missing LibSpellRange-1.0.

For some reason the curse client doesn't think LibSpellRange-1.0 exists.

Cheers for an excellent add on!


> Posted by CurseForge user Tenzian

Might be a problem with it syndicating just because its new, since I just wrote it a few days ago.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
